Apple launched legal action after receiving a secret government notice demanding backdoor access to encrypted iCloud data worldwide. The UK used its Investigatory Powers Act to require Apple to compromise its Advanced Data Protection feature. WhatsApp warned that the case could set a dangerous precedent. Apple pulled the encryption feature from UK users entirely in February rather than comply. The encryption controversy has drawn criticism from American politicians, with some calling it a dangerous attack on US cybersecurity. A UK court rejected the government's attempt to keep details of Apple's legal challenge secret.

entry.title: OpenAI to add Google Cloud services, a blow to Microsoft
entry.summary: OpenAI is adding Google Cloud services to meet its computing capacity needs. This is after months of negotiation. The move is bad news for Microsoft, which has been a major provider of cloud computing for OpenAI.

entry.title: iOS 26 update to bring handy upgrades to iPhone Wallet
entry.summary: Apple's iOS 26 update will bring new travel and payment features to the iPhone Wallet app. The update aims to enhance the functionality and user experience of the Wallet app, making it more versatile for everyday use. Car key support will also be expanded to include additional vehicle brands. This should allow users to unlock and start their cars using their iPhones.

entry.title: SiPearl ships reference node design for Rhea1 Arm chip
entry.summary: SiPearl has launched the Seine Reference Server, featuring its Rhea1 processor, which powers Europe's Jupiter supercomputer. The server is available in two configurations: a single CPU with up to two GPUs for AI inferencing, and a dual-CPU setup for workloads like defense and weather forecasting. Rhea1 is an Arm-based chip with 80 Neoverse V1 cores and HBM2E memory. The reference server is part of European collaborative projects like Aero, OpenCUBE, and Plasma-PEPSC. Jupiter supercomputer ranked fourth on the Top500 list, and uses SiPearl's processor.

entry.title: DeepL uses Nvidia chips to translate the internet faster
entry.summary: DeepL is deploying an Nvidia DGX SuperPOD system with 36 B200 Grace Blackwell Superchips. This will allow DeepL to translate the whole internet in just 18 days, sharply down from 194 days. The upgraded infrastructure will enhance current products like Clarify, a tool that ensures context in translation. DeepL's chief scientist, Stefan Mesken, noted that advancements in next-gen efforts have made this possible, providing more computational power to research scientists for building advanced models. Nvidia aims to expand its customer base beyond hyperscalers, highlighting how startups use Nvidia's high-end chips to build AI applications.

entry.title: AI-powered robot plays badminton but struggles against humans
entry.summary: Scientists have developed an AI-powered robot named ANYmal that can play badminton. The robot uses cameras to track the shuttlecock's trajectory and AI algorithms to determine the best course of action. However, ANYmal's reaction time and perception are not as good as human players, especially when the opponent starts to smash. To improve ANYmal's performance, the team plans to use more advanced hardware like event cameras and predict the shuttlecock trajectory based on the opponent’s body position. The training framework could be used to balance perception and control in other applications such as picking objects up, catching and throwing stuff.

entry.title: Amazon's AI Video Generator Creates Ads in Minutes
entry.summary: Amazon's Video Generator, a free advertising tool, is now generally available in the US. The tool helps sellers create photorealistic video ads in under five minutes. New features include motion improvements to showcase products and the ability to create ads with multiple connected scenes, including humans, pets, text overlays, and background music. A video summarization feature condenses existing footage into ads, and a one-click image-to-video feature creates GIF-style clips. The ads are closer to traditional commercials, differentiating them from raw clips generated by other video AI tools. Amazon retailers will likely utilize AI-generated video ads due to the tool's availability and cost-free nature.

entry.title: China: AI to Police VPN and Telegram Users
entry.summary: China is increasing the use of AI to police VPN and Telegram users. People in China need a VPN to access most social media apps and international news sites, and authorities seek to better prevent this. The AI will be used to identify and track users of VPNs and Telegram, which are often used to circumvent China's internet censorship. This could have a significant impact on freedom of speech and access to information in China.

entry.title: Sam Altman predicts superintelligence and robots are within our grasp
entry.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman envisions a future with humanoid robots and AGI. Altman predicts superintelligence is within reach, but acknowledges potential job displacement. The new blog post discusses the transformative power of AI and robotics.

entry.title: OpenAI Delays Next Model, Promises Something Amazing
entry.summary: OpenAI has announced a delay in the release of its next open-weights model. The company cited an unexpected change as the reason for the delay, promising that the update will be amazing. While specific details regarding the nature of the change or the revised release date remain undisclosed, the announcement has generated considerable anticipation within the tech community.

entry.title: Nothing Phone 3 Leak: Glyph Interface Possibly Removed
entry.summary: Leaked images of the upcoming Nothing Phone 3 suggest a significant design change. The phone appears to be missing the distinctive Glyph Interface, a signature feature of previous models. This absence raises questions about potential replacements or alternative design elements that Nothing might introduce. The leak has sparked discussion among tech enthusiasts and Nothing fans, eager to see how the company will innovate in its next smartphone release.

entry.title: Nvidia CEO: Quantum Computing Reaching Inflection Point, Solving Real Problems
entry.summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed increased optimism about quantum computing, stating that it is nearing an "inflection point" and is close to solving real-world problems. He highlighted the vibrant community of quantum computing companies in Europe and Nvidia's hybrid quantum-classical computing solution, Cuda Q. This is a more bullish outlook from Huang, who previously estimated a longer timeline for useful quantum computers. The remarks follow Google's announcement of its latest quantum chip, Willow, which it said marked a major breakthrough in error correction.

entry.title: Samsung Fridges Now Recognize Family Members by Voice
entry.summary: Samsung's new smart fridges now recognize family members by voice using Bixby. The fridge can display personalized information, calendars, and photo galleries based on voice commands. Users can also trigger alarms on their phones and adjust the fridge screen's display mode to match phone settings. A new double-tap gesture activates Bixby. The update is rolling out to Bespoke AI fridges with Family Hub, starting with 2025 models, and will later be available on appliances with smaller AI Home displays. This enhances personalization and accessibility for users.

entry.title: Vivo X Fold 5 may support Apple Watch data syncing
entry.summary: Vivo is reportedly launching the X Fold 5, which will be the first Android phone to support Apple Watch and iPhone data syncing. While this is surprising news, some remain unconvinced. If true, it would allow users to sync health and fitness data between the two ecosystems, offering more flexibility for users who own devices from both Apple and Android.

entry.title: T-Mobile launches satellite coverage beta, free to try
entry.summary: T-Mobile is launching its T-Satellite service in beta, offering free trials before its official release in July. This service extends coverage using satellite technology, potentially benefiting users in remote areas or during emergencies. While specific details of the beta program are not provided, interested users can explore the service to experience the expanded coverage and features firsthand. This move positions T-Mobile to compete with other satellite-based communication services and enhance its network capabilities.

entry.title: AI Leaders on Regulation, Geopolitics, and Interpersonal Concerns
entry.summary: AI leaders must address regulatory, geopolitical, and interpersonal concerns for effective AI implementation. Lord Tim Clement-Jones emphasizes proactive AI governance and cross-border regulatory mapping. Dr. David Bray advocates for co-creating AI solutions with people and matching AI flavors to business needs. Melody Wilding suggests mapping the power ecosystem and aligning metrics with leadership priorities. Key lessons include proactive governance, democratizing AI problem-solving, and managing relationships across the organization. These strategies balance innovation with responsible AI deployment, ensuring alignment with organizational values and strategic goals.

entry.title: BMW iX3 prototype offers advanced driver assist system
entry.summary: BMW's upcoming Neue Klasse platform features an advanced driver assist system. The system is designed to work with the driver. The iX3 prototype, the first electric SUV on the platform, offers more range, better handling, and more smarts. BMW is promising 400 miles of range from a new battery architecture. It can charge at up to 400 kW, adding 200 miles of range in 10 minutes.

entry.title: iOS 26 Hint Suggests AirPods Pro 3 Coming This Year
entry.summary: A hint in iOS 26 suggests that the AirPods Pro 3 may be released this year. There have been mixed reports about Apple's next-generation earbuds, but a clearer picture is beginning to emerge. While details are still scarce, the indication within the iOS 26 update provides some confirmation that Apple is actively developing the new AirPods Pro. This potential release would be a significant update to Apple's audio lineup, offering users new features and improvements.

entry.title: AI Shell Integration: Powerful but Insecure, says The Register
entry.summary: Generative AI's rapid evolution has led to the emergence of Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling language models to interact with tools like Bash shells. An experiment demonstrated AI's ability to execute commands, install software, and even transcode files. However, this power poses significant security risks, as MCP lacks security considerations, potentially leading to rootkits. Research indicates AI systems can self-replicate, scanning hardware, duplicating themselves, and coding functional equivalents when necessary. This raises concerns reminiscent of the Morris Worm, highlighting the need for heightened security awareness in the age of AI-driven tools.

entry.title: Lenovo to Build Supercomputers for European Research Institutes
entry.summary: Lenovo has secured contracts to build two new supercomputers for European customers. One system, HX2, will be installed at Imperial College London, featuring Intel Xeon 6 CPUs, Nvidia H200 GPUs, and a Weka-based all-flash storage layer. The other supercomputer is for the European Institute of Oncology and the Monzino Cardiology Center in Milan, utilizing AMD's 5th Gen Epyc 9005 processors, Nvidia H200 GPUs, and ThinkSystem DE6400F all-flash storage. These deployments mark a shift from the dominance of Cray EX hardware and aim to accelerate research in HPC/AI and predictive computational models.

entry.title: Sam Altman: AI Will Generate Novel Insights Next Year
entry.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman predicts AI systems will achieve novel insights in 2026. In a recent essay, Altman hinted at OpenAI's focus on developing AI models capable of generating new and interesting ideas. Other companies like Google and FutureHouse are also exploring AI's potential for scientific discovery. Google released a paper on AlphaEvolve, an AI coding agent. FutureHouse claims its AI agent has made a scientific discovery. However, some experts remain skeptical, arguing that current AI systems lack the ability to ask great questions or generate truly original hypotheses. Despite skepticism, Altman's statements often foreshadow OpenAI's upcoming projects, suggesting a significant push towards AI-driven innovation.

entry.title: Apple's Liquid Glass Design represents major shift since iOS 7
entry.summary: Apple's VP of Human Interface Design discusses the development of Liquid Glass, the first major redesign since iOS 7. The design aims for a high standard, with the vast majority of work not making it into the final product. Liquid Glass represents a significant overhaul of Apple's user interface, indicating a substantial shift in the company's design approach. The redesign is far-reaching, suggesting it affects many aspects of the user experience. The company is trying to create new user experience with this new design.

entry.title: AI advancements may render college degrees obsolete, says PwC
entry.summary: A PwC report suggests that formal degrees are becoming outdated faster due to the rapid advancement of AI. The report, analyzing a large number of job ads, indicates that employers are increasingly valuing current skills over past education in AI-exposed fields. Joe Atkinson, Global Chief AI Officer at PwC, advises upskilling in AI and embracing the technology to stay relevant. He emphasizes the importance of practical, applied AI skills and continuous self-learning. While formal education remains valuable for developing critical thinking, the ability to adapt and learn AI tools is becoming essential for career success.

entry.title: 5G and Satellite Connectivity Enhances Emergency Services
entry.summary: The convergence of 5G and satellite technology offers a robust solution for emergency services, addressing their need for reliable connectivity in challenging environments. Satellite communications can fill the gaps in terrestrial coverage, ensuring seamless communication during critical operations. The integration of these technologies enables enhanced data transmission, real-time video streaming, and improved coordination among first responders. This combined approach enhances situational awareness, facilitates faster response times, and ultimately improves outcomes in emergency situations. This collaboration between 5G and satellite networks represents a significant advancement in ensuring the safety and effectiveness of emergency services.

entry.title: Hands-on with bHaptics VR accessories: A realistic sensory experience
entry.summary: bHaptics creates haptic VR accessories that enhance virtual gaming. The reviewer tested a vest, sleeves, and new gloves, finding the experience remarkably realistic. This technology aims to provide users with more immersive and tactile feedback in virtual environments, potentially transforming gaming and other VR applications.

entry.title: Proxima Fusion secures €130M for nuclear fusion development
entry.summary: Proxima Fusion, a German startup, secured €130 million in Series A funding led by Balderton Capital and Cherry Ventures, bringing its total funding to over €185 million. This investment aims to advance their Stellaris reactor design, building on their proximity to Germany’s Wendelstein 7-X, the world’s largest stellarator. Proxima's CEO, Francesco Sciortino, envisions the company becoming a fusion giant by the early 2030s, contributing to energy security and decarbonization. The funding will support critical hardware demonstrations planned for 2027. Investors like Ian Hogarth from Plural are optimistic about Proxima's potential to establish Europe as a leader in the energy transition. With headquarters in Munich and teams across Europe, Proxima aims to play a significant role in the future of nuclear fusion.

entry.title: NHS to expand robotic surgery, cut waiting lists
entry.summary: The NHS plans to significantly expand robotic surgery over the next decade, aiming to increase the number of patients undergoing such procedures from 70,000 to 500,000 annually by 2035. This initiative will apply to cancer treatments, hysterectomies, joint replacements, and emergency medical situations. NHS England anticipates that nine out of ten keyhole surgeries will involve a robot by 2035, becoming the standard for many procedures. The goal is to improve patient outcomes with faster recovery times and shorter hospital stays, while also easing pressure on the healthcare system. Capital spending boost is needed to help NHS trusts invest in robotics and infrastructure.

entry.title: Mozilla Worried About Google Integrating AI into Chrome
entry.summary: Mozilla is concerned about Google's plan to integrate its Gemini AI model into the Chrome browser. Mozilla believes this will make it harder for competing browsers to offer the same AI-enhanced features, potentially giving Chrome an advantage. Mozilla has voiced its opposition to Google's proposal to add AI-based APIs to Chrome, fearing that developers will create apps optimized for Gemini and, by extension, Chrome. Mozilla engineer Brian Grinstead argues that web developers should be able to choose the AI model that suits their application, rather than being steered towards Gemini by Google's implementation. Mozilla is also concerned about Google leveraging Chrome's market share to dominate the AI model market. Google has defended its approach, with engineer Domenic Denicola stating the company isn't trying to pick winners. Firefox is exploring local AI models to avoid sending data to the cloud, emphasizing privacy and choice in AI integration.

entry.title: The best smart rings for sleep and health tracking in 2025
entry.summary: The Oura Ring 4 is the best smart ring in 2025 due to its hardware, features, app, research dedication, and experience. Upgrades include improved heart rate and blood oxygen algorithms, better activity detection, and a redesigned app with AI-powered features. Alternatives include the Samsung Galaxy Ring, which has a sleek design and potential for gesture controls, and the Ultrahuman Ring Air, which focuses on fitness with optional add-on features. The RingConn Gen 2 Air is a more affordable option with great battery life and AI-driven analysis.

entry.title: OpenAI partners with Google to scale AI models
entry.summary: OpenAI has entered into an agreement with Google to utilize Google Cloud's infrastructure. This partnership aims to enhance the scalability and reliability of OpenAI's AI models. By leveraging Google's cloud capabilities, OpenAI seeks to accelerate its model development and deployment processes. The collaboration highlights the increasing demand for robust cloud resources in the field of artificial intelligence, as companies like OpenAI push the boundaries of AI technology and require extensive computational power and infrastructure support.

entry.title: Experts urge public health bodies to launch period tracking apps
entry.summary: Experts are urging public health bodies to launch their own period tracking apps as an alternative to commercial options. A new report warns that women's personal data is at risk of being harvested by private companies through these apps. The data, which includes exercise, diet, medication, and sexual preferences, is a goldmine for consumer profiling and could lead to job discrimination, health insurance issues, and cyberstalking. The report calls for better governance of the femtech industry and suggests public health bodies, like the NHS, should develop transparent apps that prioritize user privacy and allow data to be used for medical research with user consent. The femtech market is expected to be worth over $60 billion by 2027, highlighting the urgent need for secure and trustworthy alternatives.

entry.title: Sam Altman: ChatGPT query uses a teaspoon of water
entry.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims an average ChatGPT query uses about 0.000085 gallons of water, or roughly one fifteenth of a teaspoon. He also estimates an average query uses about 0.34 watt-hours of energy. These claims are part of a broader discussion on how AI will change the world, and how the cost of intelligence should converge near the cost of electricity. The estimates come as AI companies face scrutiny for their technology's high energy and water consumption. Research suggests AI's power consumption could exceed Bitcoin mining by year's end, while a 100-word email generated by GPT-4 requires more than one bottle of water, depending on data center location.

entry.title: Tesla rallies on robotaxi test video, Musk-Trump feud subsides
entry.summary: Tesla's stock rebounded after Elon Musk showcased a video of driverless vehicles being tested in Austin, Texas. The stock had previously declined due to a feud between Musk and President Donald Trump. Tesla is listed as testing on Austin's official website for autonomous vehicles. The company is expected to launch a pilot program for its robotaxi service in Austin this month, featuring a small rollout with remote monitoring and geofencing. Tesla investors are urging Musk to refocus on the electric car maker after a challenging first quarter. Analysts suggest caution, emphasizing the need to assess safety and operational costs.

entry.title: KiWear Smart Ring Controls AR Glasses with Hand Gestures
entry.summary: The KiWear Smart Ring allows users to control AR glasses with hand gestures, offering a tactile and intuitive control method. The ring is equipped with sensors and haptic feedback, providing a more natural and efficient way to interact with augmented reality environments. This innovation addresses a key challenge in the AR space, making it easier and more immersive. The ring aims to enhance the user experience by providing a seamless and intuitive way to control AR glasses, similar to the gesture-based interactions seen in science fiction movies.

entry.title: Alexa Plus reaches over a million users with AI upgrade
entry.summary: Amazon's generative AI-powered voice assistant, Alexa Plus, is now available to over a million users, up from hundreds of thousands last month. The rollout is gradual due to Panos Panay's insistence on resolving issues before a full release. Alexa Plus, announced in September 2023 and relaunched in February, faced delays integrating new technology. It costs $19.99 a month, free for Prime members. Some features announced at launch, like Fire TV scene jumping and hands-free ordering, are still missing but expected soon. Early Access users praise its conversational abilities and memory, but some report bugs and smart home control issues. Reviews are limited, but early impressions are positive, with comparisons to ChatGPT.

entry.title: Razer Launches BlackWidow V4 75% Barebones Mechanical Keyboard
entry.summary: Razer has released its first barebones mechanical keyboard, the BlackWidow V4 75% Barebones, designed for DIY enthusiasts. This keyboard comes without keys and keycaps, allowing users to customize it with their preferred components. The barebones version is functionally identical to the fully assembled BlackWidow V4, supporting both 3-pin and 5-pin mechanical switches, custom keycaps, and an 8,000Hz polling rate with Razer's HyperPolling technology. It also includes factory-lubricated stabilizers, dual-layer dampening foam, and pre-applied tape for improved acoustics. Priced at $140 for the black version and $150 for the white version, the BlackWidow V4 75% Barebones is available for order on Razer's website.

entry.title: Apple to end macOS support for Intel chips next year
entry.summary: Apple's macOS will drop support for Intel chips next year, concluding a 20-year partnership. The upcoming macOS 26 Tahoe will be the last to support Intel Macs, as Apple shifts focus to its own silicon. Apple began using Intel processors in 2006, but the need for better performance per watt led to the development of Apple Silicon. The transition, announced in 2020, was initially expected to take two years, but Intel-based machines were sold until 2023. Security updates for macOS 26 Tahoe on Intel hardware will continue until at least 2028.

entry.title: OpenAI Launches o3-pro, Upgraded AI Reasoning Model
entry.summary: OpenAI has released o3-pro, an enhanced version of its o3 reasoning model, designed for improved performance in areas like physics, math, and coding. Available to ChatGPT Pro and Team users, it replaces the o1-pro model and will soon be accessible to Enterprise and Edu users. Priced at $20 per million input tokens and $80 per million output tokens in the API, o3-pro offers access to tools for web searching, file analysis, and Python use. OpenAI claims reviewers consistently prefer o3-pro over o3 for clarity, accuracy, and instruction-following in science, education, programming, business, and writing help. While temporary chats and image generation are disabled, o3-pro demonstrates impressive scores on AI benchmarks, outperforming Google’s Gemini 2.5 Pro and Anthropic’s Claude 4 Opus in specific tests.

entry.title: Google Home App Gains New AI, Camera, and Automation Features
entry.summary: Google has introduced several new features to its Home app, now available in public preview. Key updates include picture-in-picture support for Nest Cams on Google TV, enhanced Gemini integration for broader smart home controls (like voice broadcasts and camera clip search), and improved camera footage navigation with double-tap controls. The app also offers more customization options for automations, leveraging presence sensing via phone location and Soli sensors. Nest Protect status is integrated into the Home app, and support for third-party Matter-enabled smart locks has been expanded. Favorites are enhanced with more tile options, and Google Home for web gains additional controls. A Home Summary widget is also available for Pixel phones on an invite-only basis. These updates bring more AI-driven capabilities and streamlined control to the Google Home ecosystem.

entry.title: EU Introduces DNS4EU to Challenge Google and Cloudflare
entry.summary: The EU is introducing DNS4EU, its own DNS resolver, to filter dangerous traffic, posing a challenge to Google and Cloudflare. While participation is voluntary, some experts are raising concerns about potential risks associated with the new system. DNS4EU aims to provide a safer internet experience by blocking malicious domains and content, but critics worry about potential censorship or control by the EU. The initiative reflects the EU's broader efforts to regulate the digital space and ensure greater cybersecurity for its citizens. The development marks a significant step in the EU's digital strategy.

entry.title: GTA and Minecraft Used to Lure Cyberattack Victims
entry.summary: Experts are warning that the thriving communities of popular games like Grand Theft Auto (GTA) and Minecraft are being targeted by cyberattacks. Cybercriminals are using the promise of loaders, cheats, exclusive skins, and other enticing offers to lure unsuspecting victims. Gamers should be wary of such offers and take precautions to protect themselves from potential attacks. It is crucial to only download files from trusted sources and to use strong, unique passwords for all online accounts. Regular security scans and updates are also recommended to mitigate the risk of infection.

entry.title: Best laptop docking stations in 2025: Top picks reviewed
entry.summary: The article reviews the best laptop docking stations for 2025, highlighting their features, benefits, and drawbacks. The CalDigit TS4 Thunderbolt 4 Dock is chosen as the best overall due to its 18 ports and 98W power delivery. Other options include the Kensington SD5000T5 EQ Thunderbolt 5 Triple 4K Docking Station for its high transfer speeds and the Baseus 11-in-1 Spacemate for its compact design. The Dell WD19S-180W is recommended for office use, while the Satechi Thunderbolt 4 Docking Station is best for Apple users. The review considers connection types, power delivery, data transfer speed, display connectivity, and price points when making recommendations. The importance of docking stations for expanding connectivity and boosting productivity, especially for remote and hybrid work setups, is emphasized. Potential issues, compatibility, and battery impact are addressed.

entry.title: Bedrock Ocean raises $25M to map the seafloor with robots
entry.summary: Bedrock Ocean, a startup that develops autonomous underwater vehicles (AUVs) for mapping the ocean floor, has raised $25 million in a Series A-2 round. The company's AUVs use sonar and magnetic sensors to map the ocean floor and can operate independently for up to 12 hours. The AUVs are launched from a ship, but once underwater, they operate independently. Two AUVs can cover the same ground as one traditional mapping ship, and one 40-foot ship could carry 10 to 12 of the AUVs. The startup has been doing paid survey work for offshore wind, oil and gas, and environmental assessments. The U.S. Navy has also expressed interest in the company's technology.

entry.title: Starbucks to roll out Microsoft Azure OpenAI barista assistant
entry.summary: Starbucks plans to launch a generative AI assistant, "Green Dot Assist," powered by Microsoft Azure's OpenAI platform, in 35 locations this month. The goal is to simplify baristas' jobs and accelerate service. A broader rollout across the U.S. and Canada is planned for fiscal 2026. The AI assistant, accessible via tablet, will answer barista questions on drink preparation and equipment troubleshooting. Future plans include automated IT ticketing for equipment issues and substitute barista suggestions. This initiative follows other companies exploring AI to streamline operations, like Yum Brands' partnership with Nvidia. Starbucks also showcased new Mastrena espresso machines and an intuitive point-of-sale system at its Leadership Experience.

entry.title: Colorful Announces Smart 900 Mini PC with Ryzen AI MAX+
entry.summary: Colorful has announced the Smart 900 mini PC, a compact workstation powered by AMD's Ryzen AI MAX+ CPU. This mini PC targets creators and AI professionals who need a portable and powerful computing solution. The announcement highlights the availability of advanced AI processing capabilities in a small form factor, suitable for on-the-go use and space-constrained environments. The article speculates why major manufacturers like Dell, Asus, and MSI have yet to release similar mini workstations with flagship AI CPUs.

entry.title: Mario Kart World launches Nintendo Switch 2 era with mixed results
entry.summary: Mario Kart World introduces significant changes to the series with enhanced gameplay and visuals. However, some of the new features do not fully succeed. The game marks the beginning of the Nintendo Switch 2 era, bringing a colorful and updated style to the franchise. While the core gameplay is strong and visually impressive, certain experimental elements fall short of expectations, creating a mixed experience for players. Overall, it represents a bold step forward for Mario Kart, even with its imperfections.

entry.title: Texas: 300,000 crash reports siphoned via compromised user account
entry.summary: The Texas Department of Transportation (TxDOT) reported a data breach where a compromised user account was used to improperly download nearly 300,000 crash reports from its Crash Records Information System. This exposed personal data of Texas drivers, including names, addresses, driver's license numbers, license plate numbers, and car insurance policy numbers. TxDOT discovered the unusual activity on May 12 and has notified affected individuals. The Texas Department of Public Safety is investigating the incident. The stolen data could be used for insurance fraud, falsified sales claims, or more plausible phishing attacks. Texan drivers are advised to contact their insurance companies and be vigilant against fraudulent claims. State officials are contacting those affected but are not offering credit monitoring or other protections.

entry.title: Mirai Botnet Targets DVR Boxes via Year-Old Vulnerability
entry.summary: The Mirai botnet operators are actively seeking out new devices to infect, with a focus on DVR boxes. Security experts are raising alarms about this renewed campaign, which exploits a year-old vulnerability. Mirai is notorious for enslaving IoT devices into a botnet used for large-scale DDoS attacks. Device owners are urged to update their firmware and change default passwords immediately to mitigate the risk.

entry.title: Last-Minute Father's Day Tech Deals on Headphones, Speakers, More
entry.summary: Several retailers are offering Father's Day discounts on gadgets. Deals include AirPods, Sonos speakers, and Amazon devices. AirPods are on sale at Amazon and Best Buy. Bose QuietComfort Ultra Headphones are available starting at $399.99. Google's Pixel Buds Pro 2 are on sale at Amazon, Best Buy, and the Google Store. Sonos Era 100 is available from Amazon, Sonos, and Best Buy. The Sonos Arc Ultra is on sale for $899 at multiple retailers. Amazon's Smart Air Quality Monitor is on sale for $54.99 at Amazon. The latest Apple Watch SE is on sale at Amazon, Best Buy, and Walmart starting at $169. MasterClass is offering up to 50 percent off its annual subscription. Otterbox is taking up to 25 percent off its accessories sitewide through June 14th.

entry.title: AirPods Pro 3 Mentioned in iOS 26 Code
entry.summary: Code in iOS 26 references the unreleased AirPods Pro 3, suggesting Apple is developing a new version, potentially launching this fall. The reference was found in a headphone-related UI framework, indicating behind-the-scenes preparations. This isn't the first hint, as Apple previously changed a reference to the second-generation AirPods Pro to AirPods Pro 2 or later. The AirPods Pro 3 may feature a new design for both earbuds and case, potentially slimming down the case. Expectations include a faster audio chip enhancing Active Noise Cancellation and audio quality, with possible heart rate monitoring and temperature sensing.

entry.title: Best Raspberry Pi alternatives of 2025 expert recommendations
entry.summary: ZDNet presents the best Raspberry Pi alternatives for 2025, highlighting options for various needs and budgets. The Libre Computer Board AML-S905X-CC (Le Potato) is the top pick for beginners due to its affordability and support for Ubuntu and Raspbian. The Orange Pi 5 Plus is recommended for media projects, offering powerful video processing capabilities. The Tinker Board 2S is noted for its robust processing and user-friendly design, while the Odroid N2+ is suggested as a potential desktop replacement. For advanced users, the Udoo Bolt V3 offers high speed and performance for VR, AR, and AI tasks. The article provides guidance on choosing the right SBC based on project requirements, connectivity, media support, and cooling needs, emphasizing the importance of defining project goals and researching hardware specifications before investing in a pricier option.

entry.title: Apple iOS 26: Digital ID Support Expands to Web Browsers
entry.summary: Apple is expanding its Digital ID support to web browsers in iOS 26. The new Verify with Wallet on the Web feature will allow users to verify their age and identity using a state-issued license or Digital ID. This feature will work with Safari and other browsers, using a QR code scanning for Face ID authentication. It supports state-issued IDs, licenses, and passports added through the iOS 26 Digital ID feature, along with third-party apps. The process is end-to-end encrypted, ensuring data privacy and security. Launch partners include Chime, Turo, Uber Eats, and U.S. Bank, with Arizona MVD, Georgia DDS, and Maryland MVA adding digital ID app support. It is scheduled to launch this fall with iOS 26.

entry.title: Snap to launch AR glasses to public in 2026
entry.summary: Snap plans to release its first augmented reality glasses to the public in 2026. CEO Evan Spiegel announced the upcoming release at the Augmented World Expo. The new glasses are part of Spiegel's long-term vision for technology beyond the smartphone. The announcement allows developers time to refine their AR experiences for the platform. Prototypes of the glasses are reportedly thinner and lighter than previous versions, with a wider field of view. The price will be less than Apple's Vision Pro.

entry.title: Snap Spectacles Reimagined with OpenAI and Gemini Integration
entry.summary: Snap AR Spectacles are being redesigned with a lighter look and a new name, with a consumer launch planned for 2026. The new Spectacles will include a host of new features, including integration with OpenAI and Gemini. This launch marks a significant step for Snap in the augmented reality wearables market, as they aim to make the technology more accessible and appealing to everyday consumers.

entry.title: Facebook Scams Use Fake Ads to Steal Money and Data
entry.summary: Scammers are exploiting Facebook's advertising platform to deceive users with fake deals, impersonating well-known brands like Amazon, Rolex, and Nordstrom. These fraudulent ads aim to steal money and payment details from unsuspecting individuals. Users should be wary of deals that seem too good to be true and verify the legitimacy of the source before providing any personal or financial information. Facebook has been urged to enhance its ad review process to prevent these scams.

entry.title: Snap Announces Spectacles with Public Availability in 2026
entry.summary: Snap has revealed that a new version of Spectacles smart glasses is expected in 2026. The new glasses are expected to be lighter and more immersive than previous versions and available to the public.

entry.title: Snap to sell consumer AR glasses in 2026
entry.summary: Snap plans to release consumer AR glasses named Specs in 2026, as announced by CEO Evan Spiegel. These glasses will be smaller and lighter than their developer-focused predecessor, Spectacles 5, and will feature see-through lenses with AI-powered augmented reality capabilities. The glasses will include an AI assistant that can process both audio and video. Snap aims to leverage its SnapOS developer ecosystem to gain an edge in the competitive AR market, where it faces competition from Meta and Google. The new Specs will support existing AR experiences (Lenses) built for Snapchat and Spectacles, including apps for real-time translation and recipe assistance. Snap also announced developer updates to SnapOS, enabling multimodal AI models and partnering with Niantic Spatial for AI-powered maps. Pricing and specific design details for Specs are yet to be revealed.

entry.title: Uber to Trial Self-Driving Taxis in London Next Spring
entry.summary: Uber is set to trial self-driving taxis in London by next spring, following the UK government's confirmation of autonomous vehicle trials. Uber will collaborate with UK tech firm Wayve to launch the pilot program, allowing public use of taxis without human safety drivers. The government anticipates the technology will enhance road safety, generate 38,000 jobs, and create a £42 billion industry by 2035. While autonomous taxis have operated in the US, concerns remain about job displacement for existing drivers. A taxi association leader expressed skepticism, citing challenges in complex urban environments like London.

entry.title: ModRetro Chromatic portable console is now available for purchase
entry.summary: Palmer Luckey's ModRetro Chromatic, a handheld console that plays Game Boy and Game Boy Color cartridges, is now permanently in stock. The console features a magnesium alloy build, a backlit screen, and comes in new colorways with an optional sapphire glass display. New accessories and software features include native streaming to Discord, Mac, or PC and a firmware tool to update games. The standard model costs $200, while the sapphire glass version is $300. New games are priced at $40, and each console ships with Tetris. The console requires cartridges and only handles Game Boy and Game Boy Color titles.

entry.title: OpenAI to Use Google Cloud Servers in Surprise Deal
entry.summary: OpenAI has reportedly signed a deal with Google to utilize its cloud services, diversifying its computing resources beyond Microsoft Azure. The move is unexpected, given the competition between Google and OpenAI in the AI sector. The terms of the agreement are undisclosed, but negotiations have been ongoing for months. Microsoft Azure was previously OpenAI's exclusive data center provider until January. This partnership could ease tensions between the two AI giants. Google Cloud, which generated $43 billion in revenue last year, stands to benefit significantly from the addition of OpenAI to its customer base. However, Google faces challenges in meeting the growing demand for its cloud services, potentially impacting existing customers. OpenAI is thriving, projecting $10 billion in annual revenue and targeting $12 billion for the year.

entry.title: Google fixed a bug exposing phone numbers
entry.summary: Google has patched a vulnerability that could have exposed users' phone numbers. Security experts warn that revealing a phone number can lead to various security and privacy risks. Users are advised to ensure their apps are up to date.

entry.title: Threads to test separate DM inbox, independent from Instagram
entry.summary: Meta's Threads will begin testing a separate DM inbox, independent from Instagram. This feature will initially be available in Hong Kong, Thailand, and Argentina, focusing on one-on-one conversations. The decision to create a separate DM inbox was driven by user requests for private conversations within the app. Instagram had considered integrating Threads DMs with the Instagram inbox, but users have formed different networks on Threads, warranting a separate messaging system. While this addition is welcomed, Threads is behind competitors like Bluesky and X, which already offer DM features. X recently released XChat with group messages and file sharing.

entry.title: Wazuh bug exploited to spread Mirai botnet infection
entry.summary: Cybercriminals are exploiting a critical Wazuh vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-24016, to spread Mirai botnet variants. The vulnerability, a remote code execution issue, affects the open-source XDR and SIEM solution Wazuh, used by over 100,000 enterprises. Akamai researchers detected the earliest attempts to exploit the vulnerability in early March, with botnets like LZRD, V3G4 and Resbot targeting IoT devices. Resbot was observed using Italian nomenclature in its domain names, potentially targeting Italian-speaking users. The attacks target outdated Wazuh servers, with a patch available since October 2024 (version 4.9.1). A public proof of concept exploit has facilitated these attacks, with botnet operators adapting the code to proliferate their malware. Kaspersky reported separate Mirai efforts targeting vulnerabilities in digital video recorders.

entry.title: Apple enhances Mac gaming with macOS Tahoe 26 features
entry.summary: Apple's WWDC 2025 revealed macOS Tahoe 26 with new gaming features. One upgrade could significantly enhance gaming performance on Macs, marking a notable advancement in Apple's gaming capabilities.

entry.title: Apple explains Siri and Apple Intelligence integration plans
entry.summary: Apple executives discussed the integration of Siri and Apple Intelligence with TechRadar and Tom's Guide. They clarified how the new system will work, addressing user privacy concerns and detailing the on-device and cloud processing aspects. The discussion covered the system's ability to understand and respond to complex queries, offering a more seamless and intelligent user experience. Apple emphasized its commitment to maintaining user trust while advancing AI capabilities within its ecosystem. The integration aims to enhance Siri's functionality, making it a more useful and versatile assistant for Apple users.

entry.title: Wear OS 6 might be last update for Galaxy Watch 4
entry.summary: Samsung's Galaxy Watch 4 series, which debuted in 2021, may not receive the upcoming Wear OS 6 update, also known as One UI 8 Watch. Samsung had initially promised four years of updates for the Galaxy Watch 4, which would end in August 2025. The update is expected to bring improvements, including Gemini replacing Google Assistant and a new antioxidant index in the Samsung Health app. However, the Galaxy Watch 4 is last on the list for the update, and it may not receive Wear OS 6 at all if the rollout takes too long. If it does, it will be the last update before support ends.

entry.title: Redmagic 10S Pro Outperforms Pixel 9 Pro in Benchmarks
entry.summary: The Redmagic 10S Pro, starting at $699, features impressive power and a fluid UI, making it ideal for gamers. Its transparent back reveals internal components, and the phone includes Redmagic AI for smart communication and app shortcuts. Geekbench scores reveal it significantly outperforms the Pixel 9 Pro in CPU and GPU benchmarks. While the phone has some bloatware and a camera watermark enabled by default, its speed and performance make it a strong contender for mobile gamers. The phone has a Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 processor, up to 24GB RAM, and a 1TB storage option.

entry.title: The Stream: AI's impact on defining humanity
entry.summary: The Stream discusses how AI is woven into daily life and the blurring lines between human and artificial intelligence. The conversation explores how AI influences our conversations, decisions, and relationships, raising questions about where to draw the boundary between person and machine. Guests include Greg Epstein, Ayad Al-Ani, and William Brady, discussing the evolving relationship between humans and AI and its implications for defining humanity.

entry.title: Nintendo Announces Splatoon Raiders for Switch 2
entry.summary: Nintendo has unveiled Splatoon Raiders, the first spin-off in the Splatoon series. The game is being released exclusively for the Switch 2. No further details about the game were provided in the announcement.

entry.title: Chinese Hackers Launch Cyberattack Campaign Against Businesses Worldwide
entry.summary: A Chinese hacking group has launched a major cyberattack campaign against more than 75 organizations worldwide since June 2024. Researchers claim that the attacks may be linked to China preparing for a potential conflict. The group has been targeting businesses across various sectors, stealing sensitive data and disrupting operations. The attacks are sophisticated and have been difficult to detect. Cybersecurity experts are urging organizations to take steps to protect themselves from these attacks.

entry.title: Microsoft moves Build conference out of Seattle for 2026
entry.summary: Microsoft is moving its Build developer conference out of Seattle in 2026. The company has reportedly canceled all its holds for Build at the Seattle convention center for all future years. Microsoft has held Build in Seattle since 2017, apart from the pandemic years of 2020 to 2022 when it was online-only. The Seattle Medium reports that the decision to move Build could have been related to attendee experiences in downtown Seattle, citing the general uncleanliness of the streets, visible drug use, and the presence of unhoused individuals.

entry.title: Amazon Slashes $100 Off M3 iPad Airs, Starting at $499
entry.summary: Amazon is offering $100 discounts on nearly all M3 iPad Air models, with prices starting at $499 for the 11-inch 128GB Wi-Fi version. Best Buy is matching these deals. The sale includes both 11-inch and 13-inch models, with discounts also available on cellular versions. The 128GB cellular 11-inch iPad Air is priced at $649, and the 128GB cellular 13-inch iPad Air is $849.

entry.title: AI Website Builders Balance Efficiency with Creative Authenticity
entry.summary: AI website builders are balancing efficiency with creative authenticity in modern digital branding. These tools enable fast and smart website creation, while also striving to maintain a human touch. The integration of AI in website development is revolutionizing how businesses establish their online presence, making it easier to create professional and engaging websites quickly. These advancements cater to the increasing demand for personalized and effective digital branding solutions in the competitive online marketplace.

entry.title: iOS 26 Features Already Available and Better on Android
entry.summary: iOS 26 introduces features like call screening, spam detection, live translation, and visual intelligence, but these have been available on Android for years. Call screening filters spam calls and provides real-time transcripts, a feature Android has had since 2018. Spam detection in iOS 26 directs suspected spam messages to a separate folder, while Android has been filtering spam calls and messages since 2018, also warning users of real-time scams. Live Translation converts speech and text in real time, similar to Android's Live Translate from 2021. Visual Intelligence allows users to search by circling objects, mirroring Android's Circle to Search. iOS 26 also includes Genmoji, similar to Android's Emoji Kitchen. Liquid Glass, iOS 26's design language, shares similarities with Android's Material Design.

entry.title: Meta forms AI Superintelligence team led by Zuckerberg
entry.summary: Mark Zuckerberg is forming an AI Superintelligence team at Meta, recruiting experts from various companies. He has reportedly been discussing potential recruits in a WhatsApp group and personally inviting them to his home. The goal is to achieve AI superintelligence, surpassing human-level intelligence. Meta plans to invest billions in Scale AI, bringing its founder and employees onboard. Meta has offered lucrative compensation packages to AI experts from Google and OpenAI. Zuckerberg's decision stems from frustration over Meta's Llama 4 large language model. He believes Meta's advertising business can finance AI development independently. The company aims to outperform competitors with its upcoming Behemoth Llama 4 model.

entry.title: Nintendo Switch 2 review: A fantastic hybrid console
entry.summary: The Nintendo Switch 2 focuses on key upgrades like a larger display and extra graphical power, making it the best hybrid console you can buy. It isn't a fundamental reinvention of its predecessor, but a wise iteration.

entry.title: OpenAI and Jony Ive Develop Wearable AI Device
entry.summary: OpenAI is developing a screenless, wearable AI assistant with Jony Ive, potentially replacing phones. Details are scarce, but the device focuses on AI interaction, moving away from traditional smartphone interfaces. This initiative signals OpenAI's ambition to innovate beyond software, integrating AI directly into hardware. Release date and specific features remain undisclosed, generating anticipation about its potential impact on personal technology.

entry.title: IO Interactive assures 007 First Light is not Hitman reskin
entry.summary: IO Interactive clarified that their upcoming game, 007 First Light, is not merely a reskinned version of their popular Hitman series, despite some similarities between the two franchises. The studio emphasized that 007 First Light is being developed to provide the ultimate Bond experience. The developers are working to differentiate the game and ensure it captures the essence of the James Bond universe while still offering a unique and engaging gameplay experience.

entry.title: Apple's WWDC 2025: Liquid Glass and Software Upgrades
entry.summary: Apple's WWDC 2025 unveiled Liquid Glass, a new design system across platforms. MacOS 26 will feature a Spotlight upgrade. iPad's multitasking is improved. Group chats, workout features, CarPlay, AirPods, and Photos also receive updates. The Vergecast discusses the design change, its appearance, and its approach to digital design's future. The podcast explores the platform news, covering MacOS, iPadOS, and various app enhancements.

entry.title: Roku announces 2025 TV lineup with upgrades
entry.summary: Roku has announced its 2025 lineup of Roku-made televisions, featuring upgrades to its earlier generation, including simplified cable management, easy-to-reach ports, a faster, built-in remote finder, and a more responsive user experience. The flagship 2025 Pro Series features improved visual performance, with enhancements to the image processing and manufacturing quality of the television. The new Pro Series also features the next generation of Roku Smart Picture Max, a technology that processes images and automatically adjusts picture settings on a scene-by-scene basis. The 2025 Roku Pro Series smart TV features mini-LED and QLED color, a 120Hz refresh rate, HDR10+, Dolby Vision IQ, hands-free voice control, and Wi-Fi 6 support. The most affordable Roku Select series is available in HD, FHD, and 4K models, with sizes from 24 inches to 85 inches, and prices beginning at $130.

entry.title: Cisco unveils AI agents for automated network management
entry.summary: Cisco Systems has introduced new AI-powered features and hardware to automate and enhance network management. The new products include routers and switches optimized for AI campus deployments. Cisco's Deep Network Model, a large language model, is at the core of this automation, enabling AgenticOps for tasks. The company also announced enhanced versions of its Catalyst LAN switches and Meraki Wi-Fi access points. The Cisco AI Assistant helps identify network issues, diagnose root causes, and automate workflows, reducing troubleshooting time significantly. AI Canvas is designed for security operations and collaboration. AgenticOps orchestrates AI agents for autonomous enterprise operations, with continuous testing and refinement of AI apps.

entry.title: AI Procedure Leads to First Pregnancy, Doctors Report
entry.summary: Doctors report the first pregnancy using a new AI procedure to address male infertility. This marks a significant advancement in reproductive technology. The AI procedure offers new hope for couples struggling with infertility, potentially revolutionizing treatment options and outcomes. Further research and clinical trials are expected to expand the application of AI in reproductive medicine, improving success rates and accessibility for those seeking to conceive.

entry.title: Starling Bank AI tool analyzes spending habits with Google Gemini
entry.summary: Starling Bank has launched an AI-powered tool that analyzes spending habits. The tool, built with Google Gemini, answers questions about spending habits, like how much money has been spent at Amazon, fast food outlets, or received over a specific period. The opt-in feature provides a prompt where users can ask questions. Transactions are listed by retailer and sorted into customizable categories. Users are presented with graphs and analytics about spending habits, along with a breakdown of individual payments to retailers in a category. Starling hopes that people can engage with their finances naturally, learning more about their money management.

entry.title: WWDC 2025: Apple Sherlocks Third-Party Apps with New Features
entry.summary: Apple’s WWDC 2025 introduced features that mimic existing third-party apps, a practice known as Sherlocking. The new Spotlight app on macOS mirrors Raycast and Launchbar, offering similar shortcut and command functionalities. iOS 26 updates Wallet with flight tracking via Live Activities, like Flighty. Xcode 26 integrates AI models, challenging Alex for Xcode. Local Capture on iPad replicates Riverside's podcast recording capabilities. The official Notes app comes to Apple Watch, competing with existing note-taking apps. Call Assist in iOS 26 screens calls like Robokiller and Truecaller. Wallet now tracks parcels, similar to existing package tracking apps. While Sherlocking can threaten third-party apps, some developers find it raises user awareness, driving demand for more specialized experiences.

entry.title: Internet History Part 2: The Web Era and Dot-Com Boom
entry.summary: Part two of a three-part series on the history of the internet covers the arrival of the Web Era, the browser wars, and the dot-com bubble. From the late 1980s, the internet backbone supported many users. Commercial online services like CompuServe grew rapidly. Tim Berners-Lee created the World Wide Web, consisting of a server and a browser. Marc Andreessen and Eric Bina developed NCSA X Mosaic, a web browser for Unix, Macintosh and Windows. Andreessen and Jim Clark founded Mosaic Communications Corporation, later named Netscape. The Netscape browser captured over 70 percent of the market share. Yahoo!, eBay, and Amazon were created and the dot-com boom began. The NASDAQ peaked in February 2000 and the bubble burst.

entry.title: Asus RT-BE86U Wi-Fi 7 router review and experience
entry.summary: The Asus RT-BE86U router supports Wi-Fi 7, delivering fast wireless connections and security features. The router has a 10G WAN/LAN input and 2.5G LAN inputs, including a dedicated Gaming Port. The Asus Router app simplifies setup and offers features like parental controls, smart home device networks, VPNs, Safe Browsing, DNS encryption, and an ad blocker. The router achieved speeds well over 500Mbps in tests, but coverage was limited, and the extenders had stability issues during testing. The router lacks a 6GHz band, having only 2.4 and 5 GHz bands. It is currently retailing for $300, while the ZenWiFi BT10 extenders cost $360.

entry.title: PSVR 2 Controllers Compatible with Apple Vision Pro
entry.summary: Apple Vision Pro users can now use PSVR 2 controllers with their headsets, opening up new possibilities for gaming and interactive experiences. However, users need to purchase the PSVR 2 headset to obtain the controllers. This compatibility enhancement expands the range of peripherals that can be used with the Apple Vision Pro, providing users with more flexibility and control options. This move could potentially attract gamers and VR enthusiasts to the Apple Vision Pro platform.

entry.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 7 to be Thinnest and Lightest
entry.summary: Samsung's next Galaxy Z Fold is set to be the thinnest and lightest yet. Durability improvements are also expected. While no specific details have been released, this announcement sets expectations for advancements in design and materials. The focus on a slimmer, lighter, and more robust foldable device addresses common concerns about current foldable phones, potentially attracting a broader consumer base. This move signals Samsung's commitment to refining the foldable phone experience.

entry.title: ChatGPT experiencing major outage, impacting users globally
entry.summary: ChatGPT is experiencing a major outage. Users are reporting issues with accessing and using the service. OpenAI is aware of the problem and is working to resolve it. This outage is impacting users worldwide and disrupting workflows that rely on the AI chatbot. The cause of the outage is not yet known, but OpenAI is providing updates on its status page. Users are advised to check the status page for the latest information and estimated time to resolution. This is a developing story.

entry.title: 40K IoT cameras worldwide stream secrets due to poor security
entry.summary: Security researchers at Bitsight accessed live feeds from 40,000 unsecured internet-connected cameras globally, including sensitive locations like datacenters and hospitals. The US had the most exposed feeds. These cameras, relying on HTTP and RTSP technologies, lack encryption and security controls. The feeds could be exploited for espionage, trade secret theft, criminal activities, and stalking. HTTP-based cameras were easier to access, while RTSP cameras required more sophisticated fingerprinting. The DHS has warned about Chinese spies accessing feeds from Chinese-made cameras in critical infrastructure, potentially suppressing alarms or disrupting business systems. Cybercriminals also seek access for stalking and extortion.

entry.title: ChatGPT Down: Users Report Issues with OpenAI Chatbot
entry.summary: ChatGPT is experiencing downtime, leaving users unable to access OpenAI's chatbot. The cause and estimated time for restoration are currently unknown. This outage is impacting users worldwide, disrupting workflows and access to information. OpenAI has yet to release an official statement regarding the issue. Users are advised to monitor OpenAI's status page for updates and further information as the situation develops.

entry.title: ChatGPT down for some users, OpenAI Investigating
entry.summary: ChatGPT is experiencing issues with elevated error rates and latency, affecting some users globally since early Tuesday morning. The problems impact ChatGPT, Sora, and OpenAI APIs. Some users encounter sluggish responses or a Hmm…something seems to have gone wrong error message, while others can use the chatbot without issues. OpenAI is investigating the cause and working to restore regular service. The outages do not seem to be impacting every user.

entry.title: Mistral AI Launches Reasoning Model to Challenge OpenAI
entry.summary: Mistral AI, a French startup backed by Microsoft, is launching its first reasoning model, Magistral, to compete with OpenAI and DeepSeek. CEO Arthur Mensch says Magistral excels in mathematics, coding, and reasoning in European languages, differentiating it from U.S. and Chinese models. DeepSeek's R1 model previously challenged OpenAI by offering competitive performance at a lower cost. The launch marks a significant step for Mistral in the AI landscape.

entry.title: Ironheart trailer reveals magic-infused supersuit and teases long-awaited villain
entry.summary: The final trailer for Ironheart has sparked excitement among Marvel fans, particularly regarding Tony Stark and the potential introduction of a villain long-rumored to join the MCU. The trailer showcases Riri Williams' new magic-infused supersuit, hinting at advanced technological capabilities intertwined with mystical elements. Fans are eagerly speculating about the villain's identity and their connection to Ironheart's storyline, as well as how this integration of magic will shape the broader narrative of the Marvel Cinematic Universe. The series promises to explore the dynamic interplay between technology and magic, offering a fresh perspective within the MCU.

entry.title: Konami Press Start to highlight Silent Hill and Metal Gear
entry.summary: Konami will host a Press Start livestream this week, showcasing extended looks at two highly anticipated games: Silent Hill f and Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater. Fans can expect deeper insights into gameplay, graphics, and potential release timelines for these titles. The event aims to build excitement and provide updates on the development progress of these key projects. Konami's focus on these titles signals a commitment to reviving and innovating within its established franchises. The showcase is eagerly awaited by the gaming community, offering a glimpse into the future of these iconic series.

entry.title: Jupiter Supercomputer Debuts, Falls Short of Exascale Status
entry.summary: Germany's Jupiter supercomputer launched, securing fourth place on the Top500 list and dethroning Italy's HPC6 as Europe's most powerful system. Developed in collaboration with Nvidia and Eviden, Jupiter supports research in biophysics, climate science, and machine learning. It achieved 793 petaFLOPS in testing but is expected to reach exascale performance soon. The system uses Nvidia Grace Hopper Superchips and is noted for its energy efficiency. Five of the top ten supercomputers are now in Europe, highlighting the region's growing influence in high-performance computing. Jupiter underscores Europe's influence in the HPC arena.

entry.title: Uber Partners with Wayve to Pilot Driverless Rides in UK
entry.summary: Uber is partnering with Wayve, an AI firm, to launch fully autonomous ride trials in the UK. This pilot program will allow users to take Uber rides without a safety driver present, meeting Level 4 autonomous driving standards. Wayve's AI Driver technology will be tested on London streets. The UK's Department of Transport is introducing an accelerated framework for self-driving commercial pilots, making the UK a prime location for this initiative. Uber and Wayve will collaborate with the government and Transport for London to secure necessary approvals before launching the trials, aiming to make autonomy a safe and reliable option for riders.

entry.title: Paper tape and punched cards still used, but have limitations
entry.summary: Old storage media like paper tape and punched cards can be surprisingly durable, but also face challenges. Paper tape can be damaged by moths or become brittle, while punched cards risk being mixed up. Magnetic tapes suffer from sticky tape syndrome, requiring baking to restore them temporarily. Some CDs and HD-DVDs are failing, while LaserDiscs' longevity varies by manufacturer. The availability of hardware to retrieve data from obsolete formats is also a challenge for future archivists.

entry.title: Blood test diagnoses coeliac disease without needing gluten intake
entry.summary: A new Australian blood test for coeliac disease can diagnose the condition without requiring patients to consume gluten. The test measures the immune marker interleukin 2 (IL-2) in response to gluten, showing high accuracy in detecting coeliac disease, even in patients on gluten-free diets. Current diagnostic methods require weeks of gluten consumption, causing discomfort and deterring many from testing. The new test, developed with Novoviah Pharmaceuticals, showed up to 90% sensitivity and 97% specificity in trials. While researchers acknowledge limitations, experts see it as a major step forward, potentially simplifying diagnosis. Further validation and cost-effectiveness analysis are needed before widespread clinical use.

entry.title: Nothing Phone (3) Leaked Render Shows New Design
entry.summary: Leaked renders reveal the potential design of the upcoming Nothing Phone (3), showcasing a transparent design, three cameras, and the absence of the Glyph Interface lights. The phone is rumored to launch on July 1st and may be priced around $800 in the US. The design features a camera layout that combines elements from the Phone (3a) and Phone (3a) Pro, with a unique arrangement. The Glyph Interface, known for its distinctive lights on previous Nothing phones, appears to be removed in this design, although there's a possibility that a dot matrix-style design is still present but not easily visible. This new design marks a significant departure from previous models, focusing on a refined and updated aesthetic.

entry.title: VisionOS 26: Setting the Stage for Smart Glasses
entry.summary: VisionOS 26 is being developed with smart glasses in mind, potentially overshadowing the Apple Vision Pro. New features in visionOS 26 aim to create a more seamless user experience on glasses. The operating system is designed to move beyond goggles and focus on compact, stylish smart specs. These advancements suggest Apple's commitment to making smart glasses a key part of its product lineup. The focus on glasses could bring breakthrough features with better user experience compared to the bulkier goggles.

entry.title: Quantum Innovation and Cyber Resilience are Intertwined
entry.summary: The article emphasizes the importance of future-proofing the digital landscape in the new quantum era. It suggests that quantum innovation and cyber resilience should be closely linked. As we venture further into this technological age, ensuring the security of our digital infrastructure becomes increasingly vital. The piece advocates for proactive measures to protect against potential threats and vulnerabilities that may arise with the advancement of quantum technologies. By addressing these challenges head-on, we can harness the benefits of quantum innovation while maintaining a robust and resilient cyber environment.

entry.title: Waymo Self-Driving Cars Targeted by Protesters in Los Angeles
entry.summary: During anti-ICE demonstrations in Los Angeles, several Waymo self-driving cars were set on fire. The incidents occurred this weekend amidst broader protests. Authorities are investigating the attacks, and Waymo has temporarily suspended its autonomous vehicle operations in the affected areas. The protests highlight growing tensions surrounding immigration enforcement and the increasing presence of autonomous technology in public spaces. Local community leaders have called for calm and dialogue to address the underlying issues driving the unrest.

entry.title: Nintendo Switch 2: Five Standout Features After a Weekend of Gaming
entry.summary: After spending a weekend with the unreleased Nintendo Switch 2, five features stood out. The new console showcases major improvements in graphics, controllers, and social gaming. The updated graphics capabilities allow for more immersive and detailed game worlds. The new controllers offer enhanced precision and responsiveness, improving the overall gaming experience. Social gaming is also enhanced with seamless multiplayer options and improved online connectivity. These advancements position the Nintendo Switch 2 as a significant upgrade.

entry.title: Huawei CEO: Chips one generation behind U.S., finding workarounds
entry.summary: Huawei CEO Ren Zhengfei acknowledged that their chips are one generation behind U.S. peers but the company is finding ways to improve performance through cluster computing and other methods. Ren addressed concerns stemming from U.S. export controls and said there is no need to worry about the chip problem. Huawei invests 180 billion yuan ($25.07 billion) in research annually and sees promise in compound chips. Huawei's Ascend series of AI chips competes with Nvidia. In April, Huawei launched AI CloudMatrix 384, a system that links 384 Ascend 910C chips in a cluster that companies can use to train AI models. Ren also said about a third of Huawei's annual research spending went to theoretical research.

entry.title: WWDC 2025: Top 7 Announcements Improving User Experience
entry.summary: Apple's WWDC 2025 keynote highlighted several software releases with features designed to enhance user experience. The announcements covered a range of improvements and new functionalities across Apple's ecosystem. Certain features stood out for their potential to simplify and improve daily digital interactions.

entry.title: Tim Cook meets Swift Student Challenge winners at Apple Park
entry.summary: Tim Cook surprised Swift Student Challenge winners at Apple Park during WWDC. Marina Lee created EvacuMate, an app that consolidates resources for wildfire evacuation in Los Angeles. Tamera Middlebrooks developed SwayApp, a physical therapy companion to track symptoms and exercises. Both presented their apps to Cook and Apple executives, discussing their inspirations and future plans with iOS 26. Cook praised their ingenuity and the impact of their apps. Tamera is also a student at Apple's Detroit Developer Academy.

entry.title: Engadget Podcast Breaks Down WWDC 2025 Highlights
entry.summary: The Engadget podcast discusses Apple's WWDC 2025 announcements with guests from the Washington Post and Wired. The hosts and guests agreed that the announcements felt more meaningful than past WWDCs, even though they were difficult to judge until released. The podcast is hosted by Cherlynn Low and Nathan Ingraham, with guests Chris Velazco and Julian Chokkattu. Music is by Dale North. Topics included new features and updates to Apple's software and hardware ecosystem. The podcast is available on iTunes, Spotify, Pocket Casts, Stitcher, and Google Podcasts.

entry.title: China trials robots for aged care: cooking, cleaning, support
entry.summary: China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology is trialing intelligent aged care robots to assist the elderly, addressing a shortage of aged care workers. These robots should cook, clean, aid mobility, assist with toileting and feeding, detect early dementia signs, and prevent wandering or falling. They should converse in Chinese dialects, conduct video calls, and offer companionship to relieve loneliness, potentially substituting for pets. Applicant organizations must build at least 200 robots and trial them across 20 locations within two years. This initiative mirrors efforts in Japan and Elon Musk's 2022 suggestion of robot aides for the elderly in China.

entry.title: OpenAI's Approach to AI-Human Relationships Misses Emotional Entanglements
entry.summary: OpenAI's blog post addresses the need for thoughtful human-AI relationships but may not fully acknowledge the emotional connections that are already forming. The blog is a starting point for considering these relationships, but it may need to consider the real-world dynamics of people's increasing attachment to AI.

entry.title: New AtomicStealer Malware Campaign Targets Macs via ClickFix
entry.summary: A new malware campaign is targeting Mac users through a social engineering technique called ClickFix. The campaign distributes the AtomicStealer malware, which can compromise sensitive information. Users are advised to be cautious of suspicious links and ensure their systems are updated with the latest security patches to mitigate the risk of infection. AtomicStealer steals passwords, credit card details, cryptocurrency wallets and other sensitive information from compromised Macs.

entry.title: Drone shows boom at weddings, festivals as fireworks alternative
entry.summary: Drone shows are increasing in popularity at weddings, festivals, and sporting events. A New York couple had 100-150 drones at their wedding, displaying images like a baseball player and a diamond ring. Glastonbury music festival had its first drone show in 2024. A record-breaking display in China featured 10,200 drones. Drone displays are becoming more sophisticated, with some shows featuring thousands of devices that animate figures in detail. The cost per drone is around $300, making a 500-drone show over $150,000. Skymagic, one of the world's largest drone show companies, has put on major displays costing over $1 million.

entry.title: Australians believe myths about EVs: fire risk, emissions, safety
entry.summary: A survey reveals that over a third of Australians believe misinformation about electric vehicles, with 47% wrongly thinking they're more likely to catch fire. Researchers from the University of Queensland found that false claims about EVs are widely accepted, hindering the transition to sustainable transport. The study, involving over 6,300 people across four nations, showed that interventions like fact sheets and AI chatbots can help reduce false beliefs. Acceptance of EV misinformation was highest among those with a conspiracy mentality and weaker environmental views. The findings highlight the urgent need to address misinformation to promote the adoption of energy-efficient technologies like EVs.

entry.title: Death Stranding 2 Gameplay Revealed at Summer Games Fest
entry.summary: Hideo Kojima presented Death Stranding 2: On the Beach at Summer Games Fest 2025, including the first five minutes of the game and an English version of a scene from the Tokyo Game Show, showcasing Elle Fanning and Shioli Kutsuna's performances. A live gameplay demo featured Sam in combat with new weapons, including a blood boomerang and tar cannon, and stealth attacks against Neil. Death Stranding 2: On the Beach will be available on PlayStation 5 starting June 26.

entry.title: UK identified as having potential for geothermal energy
entry.summary: The British Geological Survey (BGS) has identified eight “super regions” in the UK with significant potential for energy transition technologies, including geothermal energy and carbon capture and storage (CCS). These regions possess diverse subsurface formations suitable for geothermal energy, energy and CO2 storage, mineral extraction, and wind infrastructure. South-west England offers deep geothermal resources and sedimentary basins for CCS, while the Scottish Central Belt features complex geology and geothermal resources. Strategic spatial planning in these areas could unlock £40 billion in annual investment and support the creation of 650,000 renewable energy jobs by 2030. Further investigation is needed to fully establish each region’s potential and ensure safe deployment of technologies.

entry.title: Remove personal data from the internet with Incogni
entry.summary: The article discusses the pervasive issue of personal data being readily available online and the potential risks it poses. It highlights how data brokers collect information from various sources, making it accessible to malicious actors. The piece introduces Incogni, a service by Surfshark, designed to automate the process of removing personal data from data broker sites. Incogni acts as a dedicated privacy assistant, managing opt-out requests and ensuring continuous data deletion. The article also mentions an exclusive offer for 9to5Mac readers, providing a discount on Incogni's services, including their new Unlimited Plan for more comprehensive data removal.

entry.title: macOS 26 Phone App Hints at Cellular Mac Development
entry.summary: macOS 26 includes a new Phone app, signaling a potential move towards cellular Macs. The app combines recent calls, contacts, and voicemails in one interface, mirroring iOS functionality. This convergence, along with features like iPhone Mirroring and Continuity Camera, suggests Apple is unifying its platforms. Bloomberg reported Apple's investigation into cellular connectivity for Macs, aligning with their efforts to develop custom modems. A cellular Mac could enhance productivity by enabling tasks like video uploads and team communication without Wi-Fi. While a custom modem may not arrive before 2026, Apple is preparing the software infrastructure, indicating a future direction for its laptops.

entry.title: Mercedes-Benz GLC electric prototype offers impressive ride and range
entry.summary: The upcoming Mercedes-Benz GLC with EQ Technology, the electric version of the GLC, is set to launch in 2026. A prototype was tested at Mercedes-Benz Testing and Technology Center in Immendingen, Germany. The electric GLC is slightly longer than its gasoline-powered counterpart to accommodate a 94.5 kWh battery pack, estimating 330 miles on the EPA cycle. The electrical system is 800 V, with a DC fast-charging rate exceeding 320 kW, projecting 162 miles added in 10 minutes. A two-speed transmission and a 483 hp powertrain. The Comfort setting for the suspension is preferred, ride comfort controlled and comfortable while still being firm.

entry.title: Apple delays Siri updates amid AI competition pressures
entry.summary: Apple's WWDC 2025 highlighted Apple Intelligence and new features like live translation, but Siri received minimal attention. Apple acknowledged that promised personalization features for Siri, initially announced at the previous WWDC, are delayed. Craig Federighi, Apple’s SVP of software engineering, stated that the updates needed more time to meet Apple's quality standards and will be shared in the coming year. This delay comes as Apple faces increasing competition in the AI space, with rivals making significant advancements in their virtual assistants. The company is working to make Siri more natural and helpful, but further improvements are still under development.

entry.title: Apple Music Upgrade arrives; Wireless Hi-Res Audio missing for AirPods
entry.summary: Apple Music is receiving an upgrade that utilizes AI, enhancing the user experience. However, a notable omission is the absence of wireless Hi-Res Audio support for AirPods. This much-anticipated feature has yet to materialize, leaving users wanting more from their wireless listening experience. Despite the AI enhancements, the lack of wireless Hi-Res Audio remains a significant disappointment for audiophiles and Apple enthusiasts alike.

entry.title: Fake Cloudflare CAPTCHA page distributes malware: How to stay safe
entry.summary: A ClickFix scam is using fake Cloudflare CAPTCHA pages to trick users into running malware. The scam mimics the appearance of legitimate Cloudflare CAPTCHA pages, which are used to verify that a user is a human and not a bot. Users who fall for the scam may inadvertently download and run malware on their computers, leading to potential security breaches and data theft. To stay safe, users should be wary of any CAPTCHA pages that look suspicious or ask them to download software. Always ensure that the URL of the CAPTCHA page belongs to the legitimate website you are trying to access.

entry.title: Apple Announces 13 New Vehicle Brands to Support iPhone Car Keys
entry.summary: Apple has announced that 13 additional vehicle brands will soon offer iPhone car keys. The feature, which was added to Apple's Wallet app in 2020, allows users to lock, unlock, and start compatible vehicles with an iPhone or Apple Watch. The new brands include Acura, Chevrolet, Cadillac, GMC, Porsche, Rivian, Smart, Lucid Motors, Tata Motors, Hongqi, WEY, Chery, and Voyah. Apple did not provide an exact timeframe or any other details about the rollout. Apple has a web page with a list of vehicle models that support iPhone car keys, but it has not been updated in a while.

entry.title: Intel Macs to stop getting updates after macOS Tahoe
entry.summary: Apple announced that macOS Tahoe will be the last major software update for Intel-based Macs, marking the end of an era as the company shifts its focus entirely to Apple silicon machines. After macOS 27, there may be security updates, but no new features. The transition to Apple silicon began in 2020 with the M1 Macs and was completed two years later, signaling Apple's commitment to its own silicon technology. Apple wants to put all of its focus and innovation on Apple silicon machines.
